talk.author: did:plc:lshudpmool4mnk7iyg25onsd
talk.utter: Would you go so far as to say "if you were going to try printing a 3D camera this Mamiya design may be the one to try"? I hadn't thought about trying to print an actual camera thought I've seen plenty of clever parts for other cameras.

talk.author: did:plc:fey6feawsw644dq4ab37kdga
talk.utter: This is NOT an easy build. I think Albert did an AMAZING job with the design AND the build guide. And this is the coolest design I’ve seen by far, BUT BUT BUT it is still extremely non-trivial to build. It requires you to be pretty good at printing AND very handy with DIY electronics projects.

talk.author: did:plc:fey6feawsw644dq4ab37kdga
talk.utter:
This design is so complex that it is easy to get yourself frustrated and stuck with either the 3d printing or the electronics (probably both). I’m pretty ok at both these things and I found both parts pretty challenging. 

I think it’s probably better to start with an easier design, but ymmv! ❤️🤷‍♂️

talk.author: did:plc:lshudpmool4mnk7iyg25onsd
talk.utter: I would go with your advice b/c it rings true. Start with simpler designs and work up to this.

talk.author: did:plc:lshudpmool4mnk7iyg25onsd
talk.utter: I would go with your advice b/c it rings true. Start with simpler designs and work up to this.

talk.author: did:plc:fey6feawsw644dq4ab37kdga
talk.utter:
That’s what I’d do. 👍

Can make some alternate suggestions if you want!

talk.author: did:plc:lshudpmool4mnk7iyg25onsd
talk.utter: Definitely! My project list for things to print someday doesn't have a camera on it yet. It seems like there would be several simpler designs that could still give good results, even if it were a metter of manually opening and closing. I think people would appreciate that: doable but also learn more
